summary: This is an email chain from May 7, 2020, between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). It discusses coordination on the Epstein investigation, specifically regarding the potential charging of Ghislaine Maxwell, her suspected location, and proposed investigative steps like a pen register and Amazon subpoenas.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as the target of a potential charging decision by SDNY for her complicity in Epstein's sex trafficking. The FBI believes she is living in Manchester by the Sea.

connections.description: M, an FBI Supervisory Special Agent, has been working on the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell's complicity in Epstein's sex trafficking.

events.title: Coordination Call on Epstein/Maxwell Investigation
events.description: An email chain documents a call and follow-up coordination between the FBI and SDNY prosecutors regarding the status of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FBI Assessment on Maxwell's Location
events.description: As of January 2020, the FBI believed Ghislaine Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, a Boston suburb, based on historical pen register and Amazon delivery data.

keyFacts: SDNY was close to a final decision on charging Ghislaine Maxwell for complicity in Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking as of May 2020.
The FBI believed Maxwell was living with a friend in Manchester by the Sea, Massachusetts, confirmed by historical cell site location data and Amazon delivery subpoenas.

Investigators proposed obtaining a renewed pen register, Amazon subpoenas, and potentially a mail cover to gather more recent information on Maxwell, as traditional surveillance was unsuitable for the secluded location.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI's New York office and SDNY prosecutors regarding the ongoing investigation.
